snippet: Unless a deal is reached, the $85 billion in cuts will affect programs that help low-income Americans, including those that provide housing vouchers and fortified baby formula.
abstract: Automatic cuts of $85 billion working their way through the federal budget spare many programs that aid the poorest and most vulnerable Americans, including the Children’s Health Insurance Program and food stamps; sequestration cuts, however, still contain billions of dollars in mandatory budget reductions in programs that help low-income Americans.
lead_paragraph: Unless a deal is reached, the $85 billion in cuts will affect programs that help low-income Americans, including those that provide housing vouchers and fortified baby formula.

headline.seo: Poor Face Most Pain As Automatic Budget Cuts Take Effect
headline.main: As Automatic Budget Cuts Go Into Effect, Poor May Be Hit Particularly Hard
headline.print_headline: As Automatic Budget Cuts Go Into Effect, Poor May Be Hit Particularly Hard
